IT_band.description: Inflammation of the iliotibial band, causing pain on the outside of the knee

exercises.name: Clamshells
exercises.instructions: Lie on side, knees bent at 90°. Keep feet together and lift top knee. Hold 2 seconds.
exercises.why: Activates glute medius for hip stability, reducing IT band stress

exercises.name: Side-lying Hip Abduction
exercises.instructions: Lie on side, bottom leg bent. Lift top leg straight up 45°. Lower slowly.
exercises.why: Strengthens hip abductors directly to support proper running mechanics

exercises.name: Single-leg Romanian Deadlift
exercises.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at hip keeping back straight. Lower torso while extending other leg back.
exercises.why: Improves hip stability and posterior chain strength

exercises.name: IT Band Foam Rolling
exercises.instructions: Lie on side with foam roller under outer thigh. Roll from hip to knee slowly.
exercises.why: Releases tension in IT band and surrounding fascia

training_modifications: Reduce weekly mileage by 20% for 2 weeks
Run on flat, even surfaces only
return_to_running_criteria: No pain during daily activities for 3 consecutive days
Gradual return: start with 50% of previous mileage

plantar_fasciitis.description: Inflammation of the plantar fascia, causing heel pain especially in morning

exercises.name: Calf Stretches (Wall)
exercises.instructions: Face wall, one leg back straight. Lean forward until calf stretches. Keep heel down.
exercises.why: Releases tension in calf muscles that stress the plantar fascia

exercises.name: Towel Curls
exercises.instructions: Sit with towel under foot. Curl toes to scrunch towel toward you.
exercises.why: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles for arch support

exercises.name: Plantar Fascia Stretch
exercises.instructions: Sit, cross ankle over knee. Pull toes back toward shin.
exercises.why: Directly stretches plantar fascia to reduce morning pain

exercises.name: Marble Pickups
exercises.instructions: Use toes to pick up marbles one at a time, place in cup.
exercises.why: Strengthens small foot muscles for better arch support

return_to_running_criteria: No pain first thing in morning for 1 week
Gradual return: increase mileage 10% per week max

achilles_tendonitis.description: Inflammation of the Achilles tendon, causing pain in back of heel/ankle

exercises.name: Eccentric Heel Drops
exercises.instructions: Stand on step on balls of feet. Rise up, then slowly lower heels below step level over 3 seconds.
exercises.why: THE gold standard for Achilles healing - eccentric loading stimulates tendon repair

exercises.name: Calf Raises (Straight Leg)
exercises.instructions: Stand, rise up onto toes. Hold 2 seconds, lower slowly.
exercises.why: Strengthens gastrocnemius to support Achilles tendon

exercises.name: Calf Raises (Bent Knee)
exercises.instructions: Stand, bend knees slightly. Rise onto toes. Hold 2 seconds, lower.
exercises.why: Strengthens soleus muscle which also attaches to Achilles

exercises.name: Achilles Tendon Massage
exercises.instructions: Gently massage Achilles tendon with thumb and fingers, working up and down.
exercises.why: Improves blood flow and reduces adhesions

training_modifications: NO speed work or hills for 4 weeks
Avoid toe-running - focus on midfoot strike
return_to_running_criteria: No pain when walking or during daily activities
Can perform 3x15 single-leg heel raises pain-free
Very gradual return: 2-3 miles every other day for 2 weeks

shin_splints.description: Pain along the inner edge of the shin bone

exercises.name: Toe Raises
exercises.instructions: Stand, lift toes up while keeping heels on ground. Hold 2 seconds.
exercises.why: Strengthens tibialis anterior to reduce shin stress

exercises.name: Ankle Alphabet
exercises.instructions: Sit, lift foot off ground. 'Write' the alphabet with your toes.
exercises.why: Improves ankle mobility and strength in all directions

exercises.name: Resistance Band Dorsiflexion
exercises.instructions: Sit, loop band around foot. Pull toes toward shin against resistance.
exercises.why: Directly strengthens muscles that support the shin

exercises.name: Shin Massage with Ice Cup
exercises.instructions: Freeze water in paper cup. Peel back paper and massage shins in circles.
exercises.why: Reduces inflammation and promotes healing

training_modifications: Run on soft surfaces (grass, trail) only
return_to_running_criteria: No pain when hopping on one leg
Return gradually on soft surfaces first

runners_knee.description: Pain around or behind the kneecap, often during running or stairs

exercises.name: Terminal Knee Extensions
exercises.instructions: Stand with resistance band behind knee. Straighten leg fully against resistance.
exercises.why: Strengthens VMO (inner quad) for proper kneecap tracking

exercises.name: Wall Sits
exercises.instructions: Back against wall, slide down to 90° knee bend. Hold position.
exercises.why: Builds quad endurance for knee stability

exercises.name: Step Downs (Eccentric)
exercises.instructions: Stand on step, slowly lower opposite leg to tap floor. Rise back up.
exercises.why: Eccentric quad loading improves patellar tracking

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.instructions: Kneel, one foot forward. Push hips forward until stretch in front of back hip.
exercises.why: Tight hip flexors alter running mechanics and stress the knee

return_to_running_criteria: Gradual return with focus on form
